title: Expressing Feelings with 'cảm thấy'
content:
When describing how you feel, always use **'cảm thấy'** (to feel) before the emotion or sensation.

Example: 'cảm thấy sốt' means 'to feel feverish'.

**Note:** 'bị' is typically omitted with 'cảm thấy', even though 'bị' is used for negative passive experiences in other contexts.

title: Two Meanings of 'không được'
content:
**'không được'** and **'không ... được'** have different meanings:

- **'không được'** = 'not allowed' or 'must not'
- **'không ... được'** = 'cannot' or 'unable to'

Example: 'không đi làm được' means 'cannot go to work' (physically unable), not 'not allowed to go to work'.

title: Using 'xem' vs 'gặp'
content:
**'xem'** (to see/watch) is only used for things, not people. When you want to 'see' a person, use **'gặp'** instead.

Example: 'đi gặp bác sĩ' (go see the doctor)

You can shorten this to 'đi bác sĩ' in casual conversation.

title: Sleep vs Rest: 'đi ngủ' and 'đi nghỉ'
content:
**'đi ngủ'** means 'to go to sleep' and can be used any time (not just at night).

**'đi nghỉ'** has multiple meanings:
- 'to rest'
- 'to take a break'
- 'to go on vacation'

For a quick nap during the day, you can say 'đi ngủ một chút' (go sleep a little bit).

title: Making Reservations with 'đặt'
content:
Use **'đặt'** when booking or reserving something. Common phrases:

- 'đặt bàn' (reserve a table)
- 'đặt lịch' (book an appointment)
- 'đặt phòng' (book a room)

This verb is essential for making arrangements.

title: Transition Words: 'Sau đó' vs 'Sau khi'
content:
**'Sau đó'** stands alone and means 'afterwards' or 'then'.

**'Sau khi'** requires a following clause and means 'after [something happens]'.

Example: 'Sau khi có thuốc' means 'after getting the medicine'.

Use 'sau khi' to connect two actions.

title: Going, Coming, Being: 'đến', 'đi', 'ở'
content:
Three key location verbs:

- **'đến'** = 'to arrive at' or 'to come to'
  - Example: 'Em đến Canada chơi' (come to Canada to visit)
- **'đi'** = 'to go'
  - Example: 'Em sẽ đi Canada' (will go to Canada)
- **'ở'** = 'to be at' or 'to stay at'
  - Example: 'Hôm nay anh ở nhà' (today I'm staying home)

Both 'đến' and 'đi' can be used regardless of distance.

Example: 'đi dạo ở công viên' (go for a walk in the park).

title: Intensifiers: 'lắm' vs 'hơn'
content:
**'Adjective + lắm'** means 'very much' or 'very [adjective]'.

**'hơn'** means 'better' or 'more', used for comparisons.

Examples:
- 'khỏe hơn' (feeling better)
- 'phở ở đây ngon hơn' (this pho is better - implied comparison to another place)
